title: Taylor arrives in Capitol to discuss Ukraine affair
text:
The top U.S. diplomat in Ukraine arrived in the Capitol Tuesday morning to be interviewed as part of the Democrats' fast-advancing impeachment investigation, the latest in a string of witnesses to testify on President Trump Donald John TrumpTrump says he doesn't want NYT in the White House Veterans group backs lawsuits to halt Trump's use of military funding for border wall Schiff punches back after GOP censure resolution fails MORE's dealings with Kiev.

ADVERTISEMENT

William Taylor, the U.S. chargé d'affaires of Ukraine, had expressed concerns last month that Trump had crossed a line by threatening to withhold U.S. military aid to Ukraine to pressure the country's president, Volodymyr Zelensky, for political favors.

Taylor entered the Capitol just before 9:30 a.m. and was escorted to the secure meeting room, three floors below ground, where the House Intelligence Committee — joined by the Oversight and Foreign Affairs panels — is leading the investigation into allegations that Trump enlisted foreign help to boost his reelection chances.

Taylor did not comment as he entered the room.

This developing report will be updated.
